Subjective: Hard stools and difficulty passing for ~3 months. Skips bowel movements for 2-3 days. Associated abdominal cramps and bloating. Abdomen painful when pressed. Chronic low appetite and underweight status. Tried olive oil, which helped soften stool. No blood in stool, no recent weight loss, no changes in eating/drinking habits. Urination normal. Periods regular. Family Hx: Sister with ulcerative colitis. Social: No smoking/alcohol mentioned. Request: Wants to know if condition is serious and how to soften stools.
Objective: Abdomen: Appears bloated/rounder. Bowel sounds normal. Percussion: Varying tympani, some dampening in Left Lower Quadrant. Palpation: Soft. No tenderness in renal lodges, upper abdomen, or Right Lower Quadrant. Sensitive/tender in Left Lower Quadrant.
Assessment: Suspected Irritable Bowel Syndrome with constipation (IBS-C). No alarm symptoms.
Plan: Take one sachet daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks.
Safety Netting: Return sooner for worsening abdominal pain, fever, or significant blood in stool.
Discuss dietitian referral at next appointment.
